keyword: how many calories are in a whiskey
title: How Many Calories Are in a Whiskey?
meta_description: Discover how many calories are in a whiskey serving, including standard shot nutrition, zero carbs, and tips for variations like mixers.
h1: How Many Calories Are in a Whiskey?
assumptions: Standard 1.5 fl oz (44 ml) serving of 80-proof (40% ABV) whiskey, straight, no mixers or ice melt.
disclaimer: Calories vary by proof, brand, serving size, and additions like mixers; always check labels or use a tracker for accuracy.

quick_answer.text: A standard 1.5 oz shot of 80-proof whiskey contains about 97 kcal, all from alcohol.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

faqs.q: How many calories are in a whiskey shot?
faqs.a: About 97 kcal for a 1.5 oz serving of 80-proof whiskey.

faqs.q: Does whiskey have carbs or sugar?
faqs.a: No, straight whiskey has 0 g carbs, fiber, and sugarsâ€”all calories from alcohol.

faqs.q: How does proof affect calories in whiskey?
faqs.a: Higher proof means more calories; 100-proof adds ~14 kcal per 1.5 oz over 80-proof.

faqs.q: What about whiskey with ice or water?
faqs.a: Ice or water doesn't add calories, but melting ice dilutes without changing total energy.
Choose lower-proof or mix with zero-calorie sodas; avoid sugary mixers to keep under 100 kcal.
